title: The Secret Garden
author: Frances Hodgson Burnett
summary: The story of Mary Lennox, a lonely and spoiled girl who discovers the magic of nature and friendship in a hidden garden.

author: George Orwell
summary: A dystopian novel depicting a totalitarian society under the control of a menacing government led by Big Brother.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
summary: A classic novel that explores themes of racial injustice and moral growth in the American South.

title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
author: Douglas Adams
summary: A comedic science fiction series that follows the misadventures of an unwitting human and his alien friend.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
summary: A classic romance novel that explores the themes of love, class, and societal expectations.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
summary: A novel set in the Roaring Twenties, exploring the American Dream and its corruption.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
summary: An adventure novel set in Middle-earth, following the journey of Bilbo Baggins.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
summary: A novel narrated by a teenage boy, Holden Caulfield, as he navigates the challenges of adolescence.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
summary: A philosophical novel that follows Santiago, a shepherd, on a journey to discover his personal legend.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
summary: An epic fantasy trilogy that follows the quest to destroy the One Ring and defeat the Dark Lord Sauron.
